task_summary: Robot arm pours contents from cup into mug with visual confirmation and spatial alignment.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robot arm equipped with a two-finger gripper is tasked to pour liquid or contents from a cup into a mug placed on a wooden tabletop. The task requires detection and localization of the mug, approaching to a pouring pose, executing a tilt to pour, and retreating after completion. The robot operates in a clean environment with visible obstacles mostly clear. Successful pouring relies on proper mug detection and stable approach before tilting.
preconditions: Cup held securely by robot gripper
Mug present and visible on tabletop
stepwise_plan: Move above mug to pre-pour pose
Pour contents from cup into mug by tilting
Retreat arm after pour is complete
success_criteria: Pour action initiates and completes with mug correctly targeted
Cup orientation and position are stable during pour
No major spillage outside the mug
failure_and_recovery: Gripper loses hold: stop and reset
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when pour action completes and robot has retreated from mug position.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the target mug is visible to sensors
Attempts detection of the mug if not already visible
Moves end effector above the mug to prepare for pouring
Tilts cup to pour contents into the mug
Moves arm safely back after pouring

recovery_strategy: Retry mug detection up to timeout
Abort pour and retreat if objects unstable
assumptions: Instruction does not specify source object, but frames indicate pouring from cup; resolved in Pour node.
Amount to pour is not explicit and set to null.
Physical grasp and contents of cup assumed adequate for pour as not directly visible in frames.
Frames [0-8] show clean desktop with only cup and mug relevant; retreat is observed at the end (frame_8).

expected_success_criteria: Mug detected visually; cup successfully tilted above and pour into mug completed with retreat.
No gross spillage or collision detected.
